lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyway! Before we hop into tonight's episode, we have some quick announcements to get through so bear with us. First and foremost, we have our fantastic friends of old returning to cosponsor tonight's episode: our friends at Backblaze.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's right, Backblaze-- Is the camera on me? The camera is on me! Backblaze, guys, you know them. Backblaze backs up all of your data, movies, music, video, cosplay designs, character sheets, fanart, more for just five dollars a month--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Five dollars?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So to thank him, I wrote two songs. I'll only sing one but I'm going to give it to the cast-- the cast can decide which one. Do you want to hear Spice Girls or Golden Girls?

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Golden Girls.

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARISHA, LIAM
lines.text: Spice Girls.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Matt's going to decide it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Contentious.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, this is really bad.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're going to roll for it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I'm going to roll for it. All right, if it's one to ten: Golden Girls. 11 to 20: Spice Girls. That's going to be Golden Girls.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Backed up all my shit again and again. Your app is true. You're a pal and you pay for our show. And if I nuked my laptop, viruses fill the whole thing up with porn. I would see you and you'd send my hard drive back to me and the card attached would say, "Thank you being our Yev."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We love you, Yev.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Much love Backblaze.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: An amazing cast-- friend of the show TJ Storm, Todd Kenreck, friend of ours at D&D Beyond, Shelly Mazzanoble, a bunch of other amazing people on the show. Check it out. I think their second episode just went up recently, which is awesome. It's every Wednesday at 2pm Pacific time on twitch.tv/dndbeyond and you can follow it @DnDBeyond on Twitter as well. This is the last month to use coupon code SamIsYourHero.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: SamIsOurHero.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Or our hero. Sorry. SamIsOurHero. My apologies. The lettering there was-- for 25 percent off all digital books purchases in D&D Beyond there. So make sure if you're going to do it, take charge and utilize this fantastic opportunity. You only got a few more weeks so do it. (Pumat Sol voice) Do it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (Pumat Sol voice) Take advantage. I made a--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh yeah, you did good. Yeah, that was good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think I let down Matt.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You get a gold star for the day.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm working hard, buddy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can head to critrole.com. shop.critrole.com, I believe, to go ahead and get your t-shirt. Also, we have the new Pumat voice pack that is available through our friends at-- was it-- Killer Voices! Thank you. My brain--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Overwolf.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: League of Legends, PUBG, Fortnite, DOTA 2 and as opposed to the regular announcer, you get to have "me tell you when you kill somebody, 'Poor fella.'" Or when you lose a match being like, "Oh, maybe you should have rolled a paladin." So yeah, we did a whole shit ton of variations. This Saturday is a video stream of me and Taliesin here playing Fortnite for the first time for both of us!

lines.name: TALIESIN, MATT
lines.text: It's a thing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's entertaining.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you have played a lot of Fortnite, watch and marvel at how terrible we are at the game.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This will be you one day.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You didn't dominate?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't even--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It depends on what your goal is in playing the game--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We succeeded.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If your goal was to play it and build stuff, we did that a few times.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good job, guys.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We did. It was nice. We played it more like Minecraft really, like Minecraft with snipers. Oh, this is such a nice garden we're-- and it's over. I don't even know what happened.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We had some sweet moments. We built some memories together.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We found a bunker.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We found a bunker and we outfitted it--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I really enjoyed that bunker.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was beautiful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There was balloons.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That would be this Saturday on twitch.tv/criticalrole. You can find all that info at critrole.com. All right, we also have your FPS stream coming up soon Travis on top of all that--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, next Tuesday, December 11th at 4pm--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're the worst Twitch streamers.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, no. Totally. We're the anti-Twitch streamers. There's really good people like Ninja and then there's us. Every yin has a yang, right? So Foster and I, next Tuesday the 11th, we're going to play some Black Ops as part of our recent fundraising campaign for Operation Supply Drop! It will be live at twitch.tv/criticalrole.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I bet you guys clock in at like just below average--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We probably won't suck too much. We'll have moments of brilliance followed by lots of swearing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: When was the last time you played?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's been months.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Many months because of baby.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because of baby.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was a look.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That took a dark turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: [water bubbling] [thunder] [explosion] (chanting) Role! Critical! Role! [dramatic Critical Role theme]

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Villains beware 'cause you're 'bout to be dead.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (singing) They got magic and flair, they got falchions and cunning. They don't see over there there's a monster incoming. Inspiration is waiting, rise up, don't think twice. Put your fate in your hands, take a chance, roll the dice! (chanting) Role! Critical! Role!

lines.name: ASHLEY, LAURA
lines.text: (singing) Can you answer the call? Dig in deep in your soul as the legend unfolds. Now it's your turn to roll! [fire burning] (laughter and cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was pretty awesome. That's our new intro guys. Travis and Sam kept this a secret from all of us for a long time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We couldn't be happier.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes and we have other people to thank for putting this whole thing together. Specifically, our lovely Laura Bailey and Ashley Johnson for singing that theme song.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So good!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Destroyed it. You might also hear some light backing vocals from a young Sam Riegel and a young Travis Willingham buried deep in there and we should also give a shout out to Jason Charles Miller who co-wrote the song and also did a lot of the instrumentation and made it really cool and rock and roll and stuff. You'll see-- you won't see. You'll hear, there's a little violin part by Colm McGuinness who's a friend of the show. He recorded a violin part.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did the little Wildemount theme song.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fantastic did the final mix for the song. It was really fun to do and now it's out there and you guys saw it and we hope you like it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So good and you'll be able to see all of them now as much as you want but I figure we'll let Matt make it part of the new official thing--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, and also I think the song-- Do we announce about the song?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It should be available--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The song will be on iTunes and stuff soon? Now-ish?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll see. As soon as tonight. Maybe tomorrow or two weeks. It just depends on how that service works.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's called "Your Turn to Roll" so look it up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "Your Turn to Roll." A Critical Role thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The TDs are prepared to play it again if we so choose.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, they don't want to see it. We should just get to the game, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You shut your damn mouth!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Roll it again!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's let Matt make it official.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: [water bubbling] [thunder] [explosion] (chanting) Role! Critical! Role! [dramatic Critical Role theme]

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Villains beware 'cause you're 'bout to be dead.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (singing) They got magic and flair, they got falchions and cunning. They don't see over there there's a monster incoming. Inspiration is waiting, rise up, don't think twice. Put your fate in your hands, take a chance, roll the dice! (chanting) Role! Critical! Role!

lines.name: ASHLEY, LAURA
lines.text: (singing) Can you answer the call? Dig in deep in your soul as the legend unfolds. Now it's your turn to roll! [fire burning]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And welcome back. Good job, Liam.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's the only thing I'm here for.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Using your newfound ability to instill the ability to breathe water within the party around you, you sunk to the bottom, holding onto cannonballs, and began to walk the bottom floor in search of the shipwreck, eventually coming upon a valley caldera that slowly sinks down. You noticed, aside from the whale that just skimmed your presence, the bow of a derelict, wrecked ship sitting there, surrounded by seaweed in the barely-visible, creeping daylight making it this deep in the waters. So with your lights aglow and the wreck before you, Mighty Nein, what do you want to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I saw it. That's all I needed. We can head back up now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No! We're doing this thing, Nott. We're pushing through.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're doing what? No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we're searching for the orb?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, I mean, that'd be great, if we could find that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have any idea of where it might be?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there anything else we should look for, Fjord?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hope it goes without saying, if you find any remains, let's be respectful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Of course.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have a pair of jammies or something that you lost in the boat that you want us to look for? Your bedroom or something in there? No?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we see any other sea life?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll get to that because there was a note left here on my table that I almost forgot because the game has started. This was written and left behind by Logic as he passed through earlier. It says, "Flip over and read as soon as the game starts."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's very sweet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's canon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, buddy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank god it's not, "Here's an Astral Dreadnought."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, I know. Loading the gun against you guys for the game tonight. It'd be pretty funny.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does that mean that Logic was the whale that just passed us by?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We still have Pass Without a Trace up. I just cast it because of that whale.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, that's right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, Caduceus.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You feeling any creepy, spooky, dead people, or crawlies?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's actually a good idea. I'm also going to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because you guys extinguished all your lights when the--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a natural one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, starting out right. Woo!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Perception checks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Also, I'm going to cast Eyes of the Grave. I'm going to do this a couple times.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Eyes of the Grave.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Eyes of the Grave! That's perception of 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With disadvantage?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, with disadvantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because you do not have darkvision, and it's very dark under here, and the distance is very short. You don't have any lights up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We did have lights up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You extinguished them when the whale came by. You can put the lights back on if you want.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, okay, I thought we had put them back up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have darkvision.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's true, you do have darkvision.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The first one was a five, so six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, there you go. Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12. Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With Eyes of the Grave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Got you. Eyes of the Grave, you don't sense anything gathering your attention as you attempt to reach out your essence to feel for any undead presence. Nothing. But the very cold waters here beneath still keep you a bit chilled. It is very cold down here. Looking around best you can with the lack of light, aside from the swaying bits of seaweed that are all fluttering up and slowly swaying, reaching up hundreds and hundreds of feet before the darkness takes them, you see the bow of that wrecked ship. Not much else catches your attention.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fjord, what was the name of the ship again?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (raspberry)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know, the ship that started your whole backstory?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the Tide's Breadth.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your origin story?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, the sheet of paper you turned in nine months ago.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't think I named it in my backstory! The Tide's Breadth, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am going to summon Frumpkin to my shoulder and look through Frumpkin's eyes because Frumpkin, as an octopus, has darkvision. So I will see that way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception check with Frumpkin.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, not so good. That's his? Just a seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Still a shipwreck. There is a shipwreck ahead of you guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: When we step, does it make a powder go up because it's like (poof) on the ocean floor?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you do step across the surface of the sea floor, there are bits of the silt and sediment that clouds around your foot with each footfall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is all fish poop! (spits) See that, Nott?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, no thanks. Ugh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we go?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm perfectly happy to head towards this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's go for it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You said we had Pass Without a Trace?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to try to drink underwater.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like a seal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Going to attempt to drink alcohol underwater.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. So you take, and you tip it back. The thing is, in order for the liquid to leave the vessel, you have to send air to occupy the space; there's a transition there. But you're breathing water, so it will mix water with whatever's in there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's salt water, too.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're going to get the poops if you do it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Super dehydrating.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll try to coax it out. (blowing)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, you're not having to siphon it like gasoline! As soon as you open it, it begins to diffuse into the nearby sea. It's very briny alcohol.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Gets the job done.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This darkened cloud is filling around Nott's face.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is this where Dashilla is? Or is she at a different place?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Per the song? I mean--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It said that she was in this Diver's Grave general location, so maybe she's not here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, so there could be something really scary in here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, what are the chances? The ocean's huge.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The chances are really good, Fjord. They're really good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, do you have our luck? You've seen it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Glass half empty, I get it. It's all right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Apparently she has a hungry eye.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Got eyes right now. All right, we'll push forward.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see the side where this large explosion tore through the hull. Already, for as long as it's been there, which has not been but a year maybe, tops, you can see the rust and the barnacles beginning to gather and claim the shipwreck to join. But that's best you can make out with the lack of light down here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we stick together, or do we want to fan out and go around?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I could send Frumpkin in ahead of us to have a look around, if you think that's wise.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure, yeah, that'd be fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's funny.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, it is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: As we get closer, can we see from outside the ship the extent of the damage from the initial explosion?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You'd probably have to go around a little bit, but yeah. You walk around the opposite side of it. Looking in, you can see there's some damage. You can see there are holes blown out on the side that you were facing. As you curve around, you can see where there's a large, gaping hole in the side of the cargo hold.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fjord, I know we've heard the story probably a dozen times, but can you refresh us on what happened the day this ship sank?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, no, I chased Sabian down into the hold of the ship, and he was messing with a package. I saw a fuse burning. As I chased him back up above deck, there was an explosion, and it threw me from the ship. It's nice to know that it wasn't a small explosion. A real motherfucker of a thing, apparently.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Were you being pursued by anyone?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, we were in a storm. He wasn't supposed to go below decks, either; that wasn't normally his thing, so it was strange. When he went down there, I saw him. When I confronted him, he threw a dagger into my chest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Obviously he knew what was coming next. Then the explosion went, and the last thing I saw was the ship as I was being thrown off.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So you all were double-crossed, clearly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. I don't know why, though. I didn't see anybody.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Onward, I guess.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He made it off safely?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know. I assume.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did hear tale of him passing through Nicodranas not too long ago.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sabian is the same person as Vandren?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I've known him for many, many years, and he's always been a piece of shit of one variety or another. Only in the most recent years did I think that maybe that stuff had faded between us, and we'd found a way to work together. But apparently not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys have gotten closer to around the side of the ship where the most extensive damage was taken, you can see where the top of the deck and the edges are blackened from a fire that broke out, probably during or shortly after the explosion, but before it sank fully. The edges of the cargo hold that are blown open-- as soon as you begin to peer in the inside, you can see the interior is blackened as well, amongst the other patches of sea life that have begun to reclaim it as a home, and bits of seaweed, and general sea vegetation that has begun to find its way inside the empty ship.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh. As an idea, sword in my hand, as we start to push in through that hole of the explosion, or peer in, can I lead with the sword and see if the light and/or eye is reacting in any sort of way? Or is it just static?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not my best. Nine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nein.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nein. As you begin to swim into the darkened interior, holding the sword in front of you, it doesn't seem to react, adjust, or give you any sense that it is able to guide you in any particular direction.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In the sea, certain creatures like to make homes of vessels. You want to send in your--?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, that's no problem. I give a little tug to the leather tied at my knee and cast Mage Armor. I send Frumpkin in, and reach for Nott, and hold Nott by the shoulder. Look through Frumpkin's eyes and send him in to look.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Frumpkin's octopus form makes his way into the cargo hold of the Tide's Breadth wreckage. Go ahead and roll a perception check for Frumpkin and take a look around.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Terrible. Just terrible. Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately, there's so little light down here, even for the darkvision. There's the basic outline of the interior hold. Frumpkin can notice the outline of pieces of broken crates and other elements that may have once been stored within the ship, but very little detail is visible.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fjord, do you think it is safe to send in some light with him?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tap me on the shoulder if you hear me because I cannot hear you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Quick point of order, who's got the node? We should probably decide now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I have the node.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Who was the last to node? Are you noded?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can node, but somebody else could node.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why don't you node?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You node.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (gutturally) Node.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Will water get in the bag if I look in--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I assume we would have done it. I was just playing flashback, but I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, if you haven't yet, then you'll be doing it now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it okay to do that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One way to find out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That sounds crazy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My spell books are in there, so please-- I can't hear anything.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was more of a point of order.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am bowling ball sending one globule of light in after Frumpkin to go with him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They work in conjunction to create a larger space of light, but it does help a little bit. With that benefit, looking in the space, you can see there are no bodies. There are no signs of any individuals who were on this ship, but you also know from your experience on the sea that those who die at sea usually float to the surface.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And drift.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. You do see some metallic materials that have grown rusted. You can see the shattered crates that I mentioned before. A lot of them are burned and destroyed. As Frumpkin drifts past one of them, you look inside. There may have been some metal bars or some sort of a construction-type iron material, but it's mostly melted and fused together. In fact, as Frumpkin makes his way around, all the elements of metal that were immediately in the vicinity-- it looks like there was a cannon. There were some other bits of-- all you can make out is debris at this point, but other things that were metallic in nature that have since bowed and fused from the heat of the explosion and the fire than ensued thereafter before it sank.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's mucky and dark in there. We would have to take a closer look; I cannot make out much.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If you don't mind, I know this ship better than anybody. Jester, would you come up with me, and we can explore the captain's quarters? Might be a good place to start.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you need a light?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I'm okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll drop the cannonball, and I will push up off the ground, Superman-style, in the water, and swim up above the deck.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess I'll let this-- okay. I let it go, too, and float very ungracefully behind him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now because you guys don't have air in your lungs, you're not buoyant, to the point where you're not fighting weight. It brought you to the bottom easier, so you didn't have to swim your way underneath, but now you're here, the cannonball is unnecessary to weigh you down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're Ed Harris now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Essentially. You arc over, and you land on the deck. For a moment as you glance around, it's very spooky to be back in this familiar place in a very different setting. It's a strange, ghost-ship type chill that runs up your back, looking around and having flash memories of pulling up the anchor on that side, and having conversations over that edge at sea. You and Vandren having a deep conversation there under the main mast.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: His quarters are that way. We should push forward.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Swim over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you want to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you think it's locked?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I imagine so. Could be still.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He wouldn't have trapped it or anything?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would say no, but there seem to be more than a few things that I didn't know about him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't have any-- I mean, I can try to look for traps or something, but--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, go for it. Roll, let's say, a perception, to see if you see anything strange or out of the ordinary.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14. Doesn't look like there are any traps affixed to the door.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're so strong, might want to give it a--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (rattling)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a bit of a rust resistance, but you're pretty beefy. You shove it with your shoulder, and it opens up. You can see all the silt get kicked off and slowly cloud the space around it as you push the door open.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Now I know why you asked me to come with you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You step through and look inside. You see the familiar quarters of Vandren, though they look tossed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you look inside, there's the table where he normally sat and read his books. That table is set over; the shelf is pushed over. Looks like most everything in here has been, in some way, shape, or form, tossed. You remember there being all sorts of decorations that he kept in here, metal candle holders. It's all missing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's all missing. Is there anything that I--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At first glance.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there anything that I see that is definitely out of place or changed that I remember?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Third one of the day. Let's go with this dice. Natural one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, buddy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're nervous down there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Apparently. You can pee down here and nobody'd notice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You just stand in the doorway, as opposed to doing a thorough investigation of the room, and glance around, and begin tying memories and moments, and getting lost in that headspace. You do a not-very-thorough check over the interior.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe we should get the others and-- what fucking? Extra?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's giving you your pills.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm always eating stuff. Maybe we should get some of the others to come in and do a more--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thorough investigation?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Unless you want to give it a look?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it look like somebody stole things from here?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. He was a tidy man; he certainly wouldn't have left things like this. It looks like, either before or after it went down, somebody was definitely fucking looking for something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you know if he kept anything in a secret place?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do I? I don't think I do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe he left.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Could be. Yeah. I'll go get Caduceus and Caleb.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Beau is really good at finding things, I think.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll go get everybody.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll keep looking around the room while he--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you're doing a thorough investigation of the interior? Roll an investigation check as you rummage through the wreckage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Looking through and moving some things aside because you're a sturdy tiefling, pushing things out of the way while you're off, you glance underneath the table in the far left corner. You see a reinforced metal box, somewhat melted along one edge, just faintly. It's left open. The lock mechanism on it appears to have been broken by brute force. Where it was forced open, there are some heavy claw marks along the edges where the metal itself looks scarred. The interior, as you pull it open and look inside, is set with a leather recess on each side, top and bottom, soft leather with two halves that are somewhat spherical, like to hold a small apple.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no. It got taken. Fjord's going to be so upset. Can I cast Locate Object and see if I can sense the orb around within a thousand feet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You cast Locate Object, concentrating on the orb. Let me have a quick glance at this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is one the same as another?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you find the orb, you should totally bond with it and get all the water powers that Fjord wants.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, that would be so amazing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She already has them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just because.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you're not looking for the orb that Fjord has, something similar to it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You do suddenly acknowledge-- your head pulls at the back of your skull, and you glance over your shoulder away from the ship.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasping)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hello?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just as everyone else returns and comes in the chamber.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fjord!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, this is a mess.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fjord!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It got taken. The orb is gone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but it's over there!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My spidey sense is tingling. It's behind us. It's over there. I used Locate Object.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's amazing! Lead the way!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You want to go now? You don't want to look around or any--?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, let's go now!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You dragged us in here to look around, and now we're not going to look around?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think doing a once-over might not be a bad idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why don't you guys go get a head start and we'll--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In the ocean? Let's take--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Locate Object lasts ten minutes. If it takes longer to get there, then--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You guys go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll come back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll check it out real quick.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe bring the little octopi with you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I schloof Frumpkin to the back of Caduceus' head.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh! Okay, that's a--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (slurping) The tentacles wrap around and grasp.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's-- okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's like a reverse facehugger.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who's coming with Fjord?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we should probably all stick together, one way or the other.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think all of us should go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you know how far away it was?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Within a thousand feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roughly, the direction you know, you sense it's probably between seven to eight hundred feet from your current location.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. Yes. Fine. Take five minutes, six minutes, and--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While they're debating I spit out four globules of light and start casing the room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have two minutes!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to let the flora and fauna in here know that we're looking for some stuff. One of our people used to live here. We'll be gone, and everything's going to be fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll do a quick glance for anything that looks like it could have loose boards, secret compartments.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: While they're looking, I want to point out to everyone that whatever it was that took this ball has claws, and it looks like it could break this thing open. It looks like it might do some damage to us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it dented at all, or just scratched?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How big a creature does it look like was taking a--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a nature check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, like an inch between the claw marks or a couple inches?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 21 on investigation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Looking at it, the claw marks are probably roughly an inch to an inch and a half apart, and there's four of them. It looks like an indentation for a thumb across one side, almost like whoever was grabbing it was pulling it open this way and, as they pulled it open, their fingers scratched across the metal as it bent and broke open.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's bad.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: While they're doing this, you can tell if it moves, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They mentioned that Dashilla has claws that grasp. Just throwing that out there. Really committed that song to memory.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hungry eye, claws, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Claws that grasp.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Glad you remembered that. I'm kind of forgetful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys finish doing your once-over of the chamber, you find a false shelf bottom under one of the bookcases that was toppled over. As you pull inside, it looks like it may have been what this box was inside. It has been pulled open and broken, the wood compartment partially shattered in the front. Looking through, this room has been pretty ransacked.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The books are basically mud at this point, correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, what remains of the handful of bound leather tomes in the vicinity have mostly joined the muck at the bottom of the ocean.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Here, underwater? Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe it's time to--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Might be. Did you find anything underneath? Any remnants of that explosion, package, shrapnel, anything like that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just a little walk around, just to get a sense of the place.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are stains of individuals that may have been in the proximity, but no sign of their bodies.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hm. No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everything has been cleaned out. This appears salvaged. Somebody has come through here and taken from the interior.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think it's safe to assume that that was done after the ship sunk. A hole this size wouldn't keep a vessel in the water very long.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No. Do we know anything about underwater creatures that would be interested in, I don't know--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Glowing eyes?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Jewels?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pretties?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Underwater goblins?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, there are a number of creatures of folklore and things that are greedy no matter where they live.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Locate Ariel.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, mermaids? I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a history check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It could also be someone who was having dreams, Fjord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: True. Very true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, there was one other time that you encountered creatures that seemed to be gathering and hoarding things that were shiny and happened to be affiliated with underwater existence.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm sorry, I can't wait any longer. Do you mind if we go? This is all too strange.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Be on guard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where are you exiting?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck it, we'll go back up above deck, and we'll jump off the stern in the direction that Jester--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, make a perception check for me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are the globules of light around?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If we are in a group, they are. They were around the group.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Goddamn it!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's why I said switch to a fucking dice that I gave you!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Take your pills, Travis. Take your pills.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In your excitement in having this thread of possibility towards recovering this third and final orb, from what you understand, you immediately turn around and swim and dart outward towards where the deck is, into the open waters, just as your eyes clarify to see three large figures that are floating about 20 or so feet ahead that seems to have encircled the deck. In but a split second, you can immediately make out their outline. You can see the sides of the frilled head. You can see the long, fish-like lower torso, and you can see the familiar tridents with chains affixed to the edge.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck! Now we're underwater with them?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Now we're going to fight underwater?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's roll initiative.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It seems that, in these darkened waters, light sources can be very easy to see.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit, shit, shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How about a high roll? Nope.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're good, we're good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit, shit, shit balls, shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow, this is so cool, Matthew!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Someone went to the aquatic store.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you, Petco!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, dude.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look at that cool-ass busted-up ship.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you bust up the ship, or does it come busted up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It came like this, busted up.

lines.name: LAURA, SAM
lines.text: What!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Marching order, if you don't mind, of who was behind Fjord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll let y'all crawl up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I would have been close behind because--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (singing) Caleb takes the rear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha probably right behind there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll be behind Yasha.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Caleb takes the rear.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I don't know if I was quite outside yet. I think Beau and I maybe switch places, if that's okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau said she was behind Yasha.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I can switch with Cad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's up to you. Fine. Caduceus inside there. All right, then there's Beau. And Nott?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm way back there, not even looking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Chilling with Caleb. All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wanting to be drunk, but not really.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I'm drunk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you? How are you drunk?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's dehydrated.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got drunk before we came underwater. That's the only way I could go underwater.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you remember how bad they are?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't they have harpoon chains?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Initiative order, please. 25 to 20, anyone?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Crickets.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh shit!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yasha got a 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha got 17? All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow, that's high for her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Then 15 for Beau and Jester? All right. 15 to ten?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14 for Fjord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck! Guys!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, ten to five?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sechs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh Jesus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caduceus?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Good start. Here we go! The pendulum swings wildly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: From where we were last week.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Great. Top of the round, first up is Yasha.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Underwater, is her speed halved?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone's speed is halved underwater.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Except mine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Except yours.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: My armor. Wow, good fucking deal. Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Man, this sucks. How are we supposed to get to those assholes? We can swim!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How far in this diagonal movement would 20 feet get Yasha towards the nearest enemy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Her movement speed is 40, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 feet would get her almost into melee with this one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Almost?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, just outside of it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, she will swim towards that merrow, and with her bonus action, she would like to rage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Underwater rage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so rage. Then she can use her action to dash and move again if she's not attacking with it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, yes, then let's do that and get within melee.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, she gets into melee with that figure there. You got it. That finishes Yasha's go. Beau and Jester, your turns.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You want to go first?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure. I'll use Guiding Bolt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Against which one?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The one that Yasha's attacking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go for it. Roll for an attack.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: As a point of order, can she also yell, "Don't let them leave!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yasha?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They always bring more friends.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 hits. Go ahead and roll damage on that one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That was more Caleb than Yasha, but--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't let them leave!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 4d6! That's cocked.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Slightly Norse.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 11, 15, 17 points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice! That one, next attack on it has advantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Yasha says that, Jester glances over, puts her hand out. This sparkling, radiant light goes through the water, leaving this vacuum trail behind as the bolt slams into the merrow, brightening up around its chest with the impact of the magical energy. Now its form is glittering with that light, making it very easy to spot its location. Do you want to move or stay where you are?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm going to back up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Back up back inside?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Yeah, that's good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You move inside the chamber there. Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To be not within five feet of Caleb. I want to be against the wall of whatever that-- yeah, like that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You got it. That ends your turn. Beau, what are you doing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Am I within 20 feet of the guy that she just marked? If I swim up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have 25 feet. You can get right up to it. I'll shift these guys here a little bit to make a space for it where they were.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I jump off and parkour off.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Slow motion parkour!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I get really frustrated, and so I dog paddle the rest of the way. Then I'm going to take my--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is your speed 50, then?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, it's 45. That's why I was saying 20 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, got you. So it would be 20 feet because you round down in D&D unless it specially says otherwise. So you'd be just out of range.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Then let me spend a ki point to do Step of the Wind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, that'll get you the distance you need there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Which sucks, but that's okay. Then I'm going to attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (singing) Do it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just jam my staff into its face. Not too bad. 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22 hits.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. That's good. Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten points of damage. You have advantage on that attack, by the way, because of the Guiding Bolt.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's see if it's a natural 20. It is not a natural 20. Then, okay, hang on, I used my bonus action. Oh, I get one more hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Cocked.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do not have advantage on that one. Only the first one.

lines.name: MARISHA, LIAM
lines.text: It was cocked.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, got you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's not good, though. That is 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (groaning)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck a duck. Yeah, okay, that changes shit. That's got to go. Oh, boy. Oh, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, it means your advantage cancels that out, though, so--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A melee weapon attack. Ranged weapon attacks automatically miss if they're beyond the normal range. The attack roll has disadvantage unless the weapon is a crossbow, a net, or a weapon that's thrown like a javelin. So technically, Nott, your attacks are fine underwater.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But magic attacks are fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Magic attacks are fine, but melee weapon attacks have disadvantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who is that next to me? Is that Yasha?

lines.name: MATT, LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to spend another ki point to do Patient Defense.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've already used your bonus action to--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, shit. Sorry, you're right. I forgot that that's not a free action. Okay, I'm done.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No worries. After the resistance of the water keeps your blow from coming with too much impact, the merrow spins to you. As its jaw opens, there's the rows of tiny, sharp teeth. It's creepy when it's right in front of you. These are similar, but different than the ones you fought before up at the swamp. These have longer, more sallow features. They seem to be a little bit more ocean-based, and as such, there's a variation to how they look. That finishes Jester's and Beau's turn. Fjord, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I will, with my bonus action, cast Hexblade's Curse on this merrow, the one that's in the middle, and I will fire two Eldritch Blasts at it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: SAM, TRAVIS
lines.text: (drawn out) Eldritch Blasts.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, they're both 18s. So 25 to hit both.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both hit!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Four, so that's 12 points of damage. The second one is nine points of damage, so 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It gets hit twice in the chest. It tries to loop around now. You can see the shapes against the little bit of light you can see from the surface above, but it's still very dark in the vicinity aside from the globes he has behind.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Actually, you gain plus three to damage rolls on Hexblade's Curse, so instead of 21--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, so you cursed that guy?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, with my bonus action, I did that first. So 22 total, so add three. With my movement, I will move back under the deck where Caduceus and Caleb and Jester are.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You going to stay in the doorway or move into the chamber?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: One step in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. One step into the room?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you'd still be there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not so I'm blocking the entry, but just so that I'm in, out of thrown-harpoon way, you know what I mean?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends your go. That brings us to their turn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This one right there in the front, it's going to make-- let's see here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 16 attacks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One bite with its claw and one with its bite against, I'm going to say you, since you're the only one who actually managed to connect with it physically. As you rush up into its face and slam it once, the other attack misses as it curves under. It goes (snarling). Its jaw opens to try and snap towards your shoulder and neck area.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yasha gets a sentinel attack, yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that's what I was going to say.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, they do not because they both have sentinel. We have to remember that!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If they both have sentinel--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, if they both have sentinel, they can't bounce attacks. We kept forgetting that in the past.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You can't do that, technically.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's too much awesome in one spot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's literally what it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because the combination becomes super broken. That's going to be a--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't attack the same thing, you guys!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 to hit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, and then the claw attack. Ooh, that's going to be a 22 to hit. You suffer from the bite attack nine points of piercing damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Suffer me the little merrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then the claws deal ten points of slashing damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has a swim speed of 40 feet, so it's going to attempt to pull back to get some range. You each technically get an attack of opportunity on it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pop pop.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hoping. Disadvantage on each attack.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll make it reckless.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't make-- reckless you have to do on your turn, I think.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: One was a natural 20 from Gil.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What was the other?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can't use it. It was a seven. 14 for me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that's not bad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14 hits.

lines.name: MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Good to know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Reckless attack: When you make your first attack on your turn. So you have to choose it on your turn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Got you. 19 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 still hits! Yeah. You both can attack, and it does not move. It tries to pull away, and--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's right, because sentinel! (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. See, now it pays off.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 13 points of slashing damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 11 points of damage from me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Punching damage!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Of punching damage, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whack! One hit from Beau as Yasha, through the water, carves with the greatsword, Magician's Judge, hitting across the chest. You can see this deep red cloud form around its chest as it tries to pull away. You hold it in place, unable to escape.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just like the opening title sequence, you guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I know. I was about to say!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So good!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (groaning)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I-- shite-- take it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But you're going to get harpooned in! You'll be grappled!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's nothing to do about it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take 11 points of piercing damage. I'm going to need you to make a strength check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm good at those.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that's your best. You'll be fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's contested.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You get pulled out of the interior.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How much did I get harpooned for? 11? Was it 11?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we grab onto him for a reaction?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope! Caleb stands there in the back, looking, and all of a sudden (impacts) into his chest. The thing pierces in the stomach area there and then gets pulled out. You try to reach for him, but he's already gone and he gets pulled out in the middle of the open area. From there, comes the shallow priest's turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The shallow priest?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We fought one of those last time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We did?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It lightninged us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It went great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, we did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's its weakness, Beau?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm looking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The shallow priest is going to move down and it's going to move to there. It's going to attempt to harpoon Caleb out of the other one's grasp as well. It's trying to chain pull you away. That's going to be a 17 to hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shield.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The harpoon ricochets off of the Shield and goes limp. The creature pulls on the chain as it falls back into its grasp. It's currently clutching its staff in the other hand and it's going to pull back for the rest of its movement there out of the vicinity. That's going to end their turn. Now it comes to Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (screams) Seeing my friend pulled away, I will swim reluctantly forward, stagger near him, and say to the creature that's captured him: Hey, fuckey! What do you give a merrow who sings poorly? Auto-tuna! (groaning)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughing) I'm drunk, motherfucker!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've abandoned my son!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The last syllable delivered that one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will cast Tasha's Hideous Laughter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, gotcha! It's a wisdom saving throw?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wisdom, yes. 14. Not a high mark.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one that currently has Caleb. That is going to be a 12. Success!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So do they let go? It says they fall prone, which they can't do underwater, but they are incapacitated, it says. So do they let go?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's just not in his face.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, he's not impaled or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not at this moment. When it pulled him in, it pulled it out of his body, but it's right in front of him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Then I will use the rest, if I have any remaining movement, to grab him by his scarf and pull him back away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your speed of 30 is reduced to 15, and it took 15 feet to get far out. You could, as a bonus action, dash to move up to him, but you can't pull him back because you don't have an action to try and grab.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Got it. Ooh, tough. I will bonus action dash and try to push him away. Push Caleb to the right or left out of the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say make a strength check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Nope. Oh wait, this is at disadvantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Even worse! One. I'll save you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You feel this small push on your shoulder and you see Nott drift upside down in front of you. As the merrow who pulled you in with this terrible, toothy grimace and starts going (chuckling) and is bowling over, chuckling. It's a weird moment. That finishes Nott's go. Caleb, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So those two are incapacitated in this second, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That one is incapacitated.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The one on top is not?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, he's just held in place.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Well then, I will cast Slow on the shallow priest and the one that's laughing in front of me as well as I back away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What does Slow give them?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Slowness.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Half their speed and--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hurts their AC. It's a wisdom saving of 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So that's incapacitated is fine with the Slow; however, the shallow priest is slowed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So shallow priest's AC is down by two, disadvantage on dex saves, and he can only do an action or a bonus, not both.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. If it tries to cast a spell, it takes a full round back before it can even hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I back away half my speed towards where everybody is in the boat. I move behind my goblin Freund.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You just manage to get back inside of the chamber. The doorway's still open. All right, that finishes your go. Caduceus, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, Cad!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Am I going to double this up? How are you feeling?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (gurgling) Okay. Pretty good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pretty good? I'm going to use a bonus action-- I can do two first level spells in a round, right? If one's bonus action, one is an action, that's fine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just one or the other?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One has to be cantrip and the other can be any level.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Cantrip, there we go. Thank you. I'm going to scoot past you with half of my action, if that's okay, and take a look outside to see what's up. How far away--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have five more of feet in movement there, stepping out of the doorway.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Goddamn. There's no getting back in anyway, so fuck it. Yeah, there's no sense trying to get back inside. I'm just going to be vulnerable. How far away is that one? Is that more than 30 feet away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's no way I can get close enough to get within 30 feet right now, is there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can move five more feet, you might. You have to eyeball it and may take the risk.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You know what? It's not like distance is a problem here. I'll go in an angle and de-clump-- yeah, right there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (counting) I'll say with the angle, 30, he's just within range.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (oohing)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fucking Caduceus!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a charisma save against 16.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's no way these fuckers are charismatic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope! That's a fail. One in the middle, that's a ten, that's a fail. Over here, that's a five. That's a fail. They all have a minus one on their charisma.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They all take a negative d4 from an attack or saving throws. All three of them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not bad for a 1st-level spell. It doesn't get a lot of love.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not a bad 1st-level spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The water around seems to get even darker for a moment and ice crystals begin to form at the edge of their bodies as the chill becomes unnatural and begins sluggishly shift their movements, this cleric spell sending itself into their form. That finishes your turn?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's everything I can do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Finishing that up, we can do the top of the round. Yasha's up first.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She's going to take two reckless attacks at this one that is near her for just a straight roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. Yasha, by the way, is no longer raging. She wasn't attacked or didn't-- Oh no, but she did get an attack of opportunity, so she would be. You're correct.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So 20 on the first one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The second is a 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, both hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The first one (counting). Damn it. Seven plus three is ten. And the second one--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First blow, as she swings by, carves through as it goes taut for a second, all of its muscle seizing, and then goes limp as its torso begins to drift away from the lower half of its fish body and it begins to slowly float off.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Great. Shit. So if I didn't need that second attack, did I waste it on the one that was there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It depends on the movement you have and I don't what else you can get in range for.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just hit Beau! She's right there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did you roll disadvantage on that attack, by the way?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I made it reckless, so it was just a straight roll. I'll use the 20 feet to head down towards the one that Caduceus is right in front of.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You'd be just in range for the one that's incapacitated.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that melee?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's just a-- down, it swims down.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I should have to roll, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, reroll for this one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17 hits!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, great. This does not have the extra d6, so that's three plus six is nine, 12 points of slashing damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12 points of slashing damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it hexed, did you hex it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, this is Yasha's turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, this is Yasha.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For your Tasha's Hideous Laughter, I believe it gets to make a saving throw when it takes damage, is that correct?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will check. At the end of each turn and each time it takes damage, the target can make another wisdom saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a natural 18.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait, take negative d4 to that, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But the target has advantage on the saving throw if it's triggered by damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, the advantage didn't help it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm sorry, Matt. Will you add two points of damage the last one that I just hit--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ooh, minus four brings it to 14.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's the spell--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it still resists it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wait, what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It reduced it to 14 but 14 was the DC.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. Ah, well. But it's still got Bane.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was still really cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Will you add two points of damage to him for rage damage, because I didn't add that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You've got Bane.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You got Baned.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Bane's pretty cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That finishes that go. All righty, Yasha's turn's done. Beau and Jester.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (heavy breathing) I'm swimming to that guy. I'm going to Step of the Wind. Can I make it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't need to, you can get there--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, that guy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, I see.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I make it if I Step of the Wind?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, before you do it I'm going to Guiding Bolt him, so you get advantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, are you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You would have to Step of the Wind to get to him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, and then I'll let Jester go first.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to step out and Guiding Bolt him, that was my plan.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go ahead and attempt that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So as she's swimming--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That definitely hits. That's 15 plus seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (splat noise)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hey! Eh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Terrible, just terrible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12 points of damage to the shallow priest, you got it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then you get advantage!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, you move forward, swimming through the water, and then Step of the Wind, use another ki point to get up there, fists at the ready.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Negative two to his AC.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, that is a 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22 hits.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not too bad, nine. Nein!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nine points of damage on that one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Second roll does not have advantage, correct? It has disadvantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, that first one should have been just a regular roll. Did you roll with advantage?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just roll once for the first attack for me again real fast.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, it's the exact same thing. It's still 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. For the second attack, it's disadvantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Don't fuck me, Gil. 17?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17 still hits!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, Gil! Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go, nine and nine! You swim forward, rocketing forward, Aquaman-style, and then two big hits to its face. The shallow priest takes the impact, but its body reacts slowly. The spell that's surrounding it is forcing it to move and shift at half the pace it normally would.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I just slow-mo go--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: From behind Beau, off in the distance, I, at the same time--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That finishes Beau's go. Fjord, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, I will come out of the quarters to move within melee of the one that everybody's having the party around?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You may not be able to get to him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh no, you can because you don't have to worry about it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I have 30 feet. I'll take two swipes with my falchion at disadvantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They're both 15, so that's a 23 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's seven points of slashing damage, and the second one is only an 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11 to hit?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That misses, unfortunately. As the first one carves through, the bloody cloud that's forming from the wounds it's sustaining gets thicker and bigger. It's looking pretty hurt.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That finishes your turn?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now it's their turn. All right. The shallow priest, who is currently slowed, is going to use its action to do its multiattack, so that's two attacks on you with its bite and claw. It's not going to use any of its spells.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does it get a multiattack, or does it just get one attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, that's right. It doesn't get multiattack when it's slowed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a single attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then it's going to harpoon you. It's not going to bother with the claw and the bite. It's going to pull back with its one harpoon and try and thrust it into your chest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, to me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With a negative d4.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Negative d4.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. That's two off of it; that brings it from 19 to 17. What's your armor class?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Bane prevents it from hitting you. As it goes and thrusts the harpoon forward, it telegraphs it just enough that, as it leaves, you (whoosh). It nicks the very edge of your skin, ever so slightly, and that's it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm like: That's going to get infected now, in the ocean.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's the salt water. It'll be white around the edges and really sting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's going to attempt to move away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's moving away! Get it!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, it's moving away! Sentinel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it. Roll for an attack.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Disadvantage, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not good. No, I rolled a two and a one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Its speed is halved.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. It would have a swim speed of 40 underwater, so it can only go 20. It manages to pull out of the range up there, and at the end of its turn, it gets to--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Make a save.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of them make a save because they're both-- well, that one, no. That one missed the Slow. That is a 11 plus three, 14.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Minus four. Or minus a d4.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Minus four, ten. Yeah, it's still slowed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Don't you fuck around with me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to end the shallow priest's turn and the other one's turn. I haven't done that one yet, right? That one is going to attempt to use its harpoon against you, Fjord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Since you ran up and carved at it. Or, yeah, it's going to try that. That's a natural 20.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Minus-- well, it doesn't matter because it can still only bring it down to 18, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's just not a critical hit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your ability, you're talking about?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'm saying that with the d4, it wouldn't bring that attack down at all, would it, enough to be managed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would still be a critical hit for a natural 20, but it would then be a total of-- it would be a 22 still.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I'm canceling the critical, anyway.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You use Channel Divinity once to cancel the critical on that. As the harpoon comes towards you, there's this slight, dull green barrier that seems to slow the penetration of the immediate lightning-fast pace of this harpoon. It manages to carve into the front of your armor and pierce through ever so slightly. It's not a critical hit, unfortunately.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would've been far worse damage if Caduceus hadn't helped you in that moment. It's going to attempt to move away. Yasha gets attack of opportunity.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, she does. Reckless for a straight roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, because it is now reckless.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is her only reaction. Oh, that's a 20 million. 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That'll hit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't get an attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, because you were pushing him. You weren't moving in that area, so you're not quite in melee with him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 11 plus three is 14. 14 points of slashing damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14 points of damage. It turns around and darts, and Yasha just (whoosh), one swipe with her sword. She's finishing them off left and right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yasha is such a badass.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ashley, come back!

lines.name: MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: Ashley, come back!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or take your time! Barbarians are dope, yo.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That finishes the merrow's turn. It did not go well for them in that brief instance. Nott, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Am I allowed to use my crossbow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Your crossbow actually--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Doesn't have any damage to it, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's what I said.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You drunk fucker.

lines.name: SAM
